text:
Question 06) To be or not - this is the question.
Die - Sleep - Sleep! Maybe dreaming. There is the obstacle! The dreams that will come asleep in death when we have escaped the vital turmoil force us to hesitate: and this is the reflection that gives misfortune such a long life.
SHAKESPEARE, W. Hamlet. Porto Alegre: L&PM, 2007.
This soliloquy can be considered a precursor of existentialism by emphasizing the tension between
A) self -awareness and human anguish.
B) inevitability of destiny and moral uncertainty.
C) Tragicity of the character and order of the world.
D) argumentative rationality and imminent madness.
E) paternal dependence and impossibility of action.
